the form of a boat. This broader principle is in turn explained by deriving it
from even more basic principles about gravity and the mutual repulsion of
molecules. A larger scientific theory is thus used to explain not only why par-
ticular things happen but also why certain general principles hold.
Of course, scientists often put forward conflicting theories, so we need
some way to test which theory is correct. One simple method is to u
